name.en: Special Topics on Microwave Remote Sensing of the Atmosphere Ⅰ

department.en: Department of Space Science and Engineering

goal.ch: 本課程主要在介紹大氣和地表（被動和主動）微波遙測的最新技術和進展，本課程收集了涵蓋微波遙測理論的專著和最成熟和最具代表性的應用。另外在實際應用方面，包括在日常氣象和環境監測與預報活動中改善微波觀測和產品的應用和解釋。
goal.en: This course is designed to present the state-of-the-art techniques and advancements in (passive and active) microwave remote sensing of the atmosphere and land surface. A collection of monographs that cover the microwave remote sensing theory, and most mature and representative applications are provided. Besides, the practical part aims to improve the application and interpretation of microwave observations and products in daily meteorological and environmental monitoring and forecasting activities.

outline.ch: 本課程深入探討大氣與地表微波遙測的最先進技術與進展，涵蓋被動式與主動式微波遙測的相關內容。課程內容包括微波遙測的基本理論，例如微波輻射與不同環境組成部分的交互作用，以及各種輻射計系統的運作方式。課程分為幾個模塊，重點介紹微波遙測原理、主動與被動遙測的對比，以及微波觀測在氣象和環境監測中的實際應用。學生將深入探討進階主題，包括用於地表建模的被動微波遙測、大氣遙測技術，以及用於大氣層和電離層研究的無線電掩星法。課程的重要組成部分是動手應用，主要側重於微波影像的解釋、建模以及熱帶氣旋的分析。課程強調基於問題的學習，以增強學生將微波遙測數據應用於現實挑戰中的實際技能。
outline.en: This course provides an in-depth exploration of state-of-the-art techniques and advancements in both passive and active microwave remote sensing of the atmosphere and land surface. It covers the fundamental theory of microwave remote sensing, including the interaction of microwave radiation with different environmental components and the operation of various radiometer systems. The course is structured into several modules that address key areas such as the principles of microwave remote sensing, the contrast between active and passive sensing, and the practical applications of microwave observations for meteorological and environmental monitoring. Students will engage with advanced topics including passive microwave sensing for land surface modeling, atmospheric remote sensing techniques, and radio occultation methods for atmospheric and ionospheric studies. A significant component of the course involves hands-on applications, focusing on interpreting microwave imagery, modeling, and analyzing tropical cyclones. Emphasis is placed on problem-based learning to enhance students‘ practical skills in applying microwave remote sensing data to real-world challenges.
